title: Three.js for Learning Graphics Programming
description: An easy to use graphics lib for JS

title: Data Driven Rendering: Pipelines
description: A description of a simplified render graph, very well written, a lot of concepts that video games use are presented

title: Physically Based Rendering: From Theory to Implementation
description: Introduces concepts and theory of photorealistic rendering, includes code examples as well

title: Making WebGL Dance
description: Nothing WebGL specific, introduces core concepts in 3D graphics in a very attractive way

title: Shadertoy
description: A variety of cool examples of shaders running directly in the browser

title: Inigo Quilez's Website
description: Co-creator of Shadertoy, lots of interesting articles/videos/code samples

title: Raviramamoorthi
description: A lot of courses on computer graphics, especially ray tracing, but also stuff like OpenGL or 2D stuff

title: Bentley-Ottmann Algorithm
description: O((n+k) log n) algorithm for finding intersections of line segments

title: GPU Resources
description: A pretty big list of resources for GPU programming in general, includes stuff related to OpenCL/Cuda, Vulkan, WebGPU, Metal, SPIR-V, shading lanugages

title: Surfman
description: Low level rust library for managing surfaces using GPU memory, meaning render targets, can draw to a window, can draw to multiple windows, probably useful as a reference for implementing a window API

title: Designing An Object Oriented Animation Engine
description: A bit outdated, but probably useful as a reference for implementing an animation engine

title: Navier Stokes Equations
description: Useful for fluid simulations

title: Flutter's Rendering Pipeline
description: A look at some of the internals of Flutter

title: Inside Flutter
description: A deep dive into the inner workings of Flutter

title: OpenGL Projection Matrix
description: Presents how the projection matrix works

title: Rendering Course
description: From the 'Two Minutes Papers' guy

title: The Physics of Light and Rendering
description: From John Carmack, explains 3D concepts

title: How 3D Video Games Do Graphics
description: From Jonathan Blow, explains core concepts in 3D graphics

title: The Book of Shaders
description: A lot of stuff regarding fragment shaders

title: Ray Marching Terrain
description: Generating a very detailed scene with ray marching

title: Animate Your Way to Glory
description: How to use animations for a nice UI

title: Rainbowhung
description: Rain simulator, lots of resources in the 'credits' section

title: Rain and Water Effect Experiments
description: Generating rain effect with WebGL

title: Gilbert-Johnson-Keerthi Distance Algorithm
description: AKA GJK, useful especially for collision detection

title: Philip Rideout
description: Various computer graphics techniques

title: The Graphics Codex Book
description: Book on computer graphics, especially physically based rendering

title: Grphics Codex: Graphics Programming Projects
description: Projects to do to learn about computer graphics

title: Real-Time Rendering
description: Covering a lot of stuff on (duh) real time rendering, including curves and BRDFs(of course)

title: Computer Graphics from Scratch: A Programmer's Introduction to 3D Rendering
description: Building a renderer from scratch

title: Computer Graphics Learning Resources
description: List of useful links for computer graphics

title: BRL-CAD
description: Interactive geometry editing, high performance ray tracing and other stuff, probably useful as a reference for implementing something resembling a CAD

title: Google Filament: Description
description: Deep dive into the inner workings of Filament, useful even for an overview of physically based rendering in general

title: Materials Guide For Filament
description: Overview of the material types in Filament, useful to see al different kinds of materials for physically based rendering

title: Rendering Isometric Tiles
description: Easy to follow tutorial on how to render isometric tiles in 2D

title: An Interactive Introduction to Fourier Transforms
description: Title says it all

title: Painting a Selfie Girl, With Maths
description: Using ray marching to draw a character

title: How Software Gets Color Wrong
description: Presents how to represent color in software correctly

title: Hardware Effects on the GPU
description: How hardware affects performance on the GPU in various cases

title: Multithreading for Game Engines
description: Overview of an architecutre for game engines

title: GPU Architecture Resources
description: A lot of resources on how the GPU works

title: ASCII Simulation of Colliding Galaxies
description: Probably useful as a reference for implementing ASCII art

title: Is a Realistic Water Bubble Simulation Possible?
description: A relatively simple technique for generating bubbles

title: Exploring FPGA Graphics
description: Seeing how graphics work at the hardware level, uses SystemVerilog

title: Minecraft in 48 Hours in C
description: Easy to read source of a minecraft 'clone', probably useful as a reference for seeing how to render voxels

title: Nyuzi Processor: Experimental GPGPU Processor Hardware Design
description: Uses SystemVerilog and LLVM

title: Design Patterns for Low-Level Real-Time Rendering
description: Among other things, there are some cool tricks for ring buffers here, some tips fow working with aligned data for GPU access

title: Graphics Programming Weekly
description: Various articles on all kinds of stuff related to computer graphics

title: How Normal Mapping Works
description: Video explaining in quite some detail how normal mapping works

title: What Every Coder Should Know About Gamma
description: A very nice dive into gamma correction

title: An Introduction to Modern CMake
description: A very useful resource for learning modern practises for CMake

title: Real-World Dynamic Programming: Seam Carving
description: An easy to follow resource for implementing seam carving

title: Gitlet - Git in 600 Words
description: Learn how git workds under the covers, with code samples

title: Steganography Tutorial
description: Easy to follow, shows how to encode data in bitmaps

title: Minsk - Educational Compiler in C#
description: Illustrates basic concepts of compiler construction, also shows ways to expose APIs for parsing and type checking

title: Ugit - Learn Git Internals With Python
description: Interactive way to learn about git, shows code samples with diffing

title: Building Neural Networks From Scratch
description: Learn how neural networks function

title: DNS Basics And Building a DNS Server in Go
description: Useful to bettern learn about DNS servers

title: Deflate
description: Lossless data compression file format, used in gzip, PNG, ZIP

title: Vanilla Web Projects
description: Simple, useful projects that don't use any frameworks

title: Memory Barriers Are Like Source Control Operations
description: Useful to understand how memory barriers work

title: Weak vs. Strong Memory Models
description: Useful to understand how different memory models work for different architectures

title: This Is Why They Call It a Weakly-Ordered CPU
description: Concrete examples that show how a weak memory model affects a program

title: A Primer on Memory Consistency And Cache Coherence
description: Useful to better understand how caching works

title: An Allocator Is a Handle to a Heap
description: Clearing some thins up about manipulating allocators

title: Allocator Propagation Policies
description: Clearing up what happens when a move happens and custom allocators are involved

title: What a C Programmer Should Know About Memory
description: Useful to understand how virtual memory works

title: Project Based Tutorials in C
description: Lots of resources to learn C hands-on

title: Cryptography Is Not Magic
description: Very nice resource to learn about crypto algorithms

title: Improved Seam Carving With Forward Energy
description: A nice, easy to follow improvement to seam carving

title: Build Your Own Lisp
description: A nice way to learn compiler development

title: A Universal I/O Abstraction For C++
description: A nice overview of networking in general for C++, also includes stuff about `io_uring`

title: Optimizing `string::append` Is Harder Than It Looks
description: A deep dive into implementing a standard-conforming `string::append`

title: Making The Tokio Scheduler 10x Faster
description: A real-world application of work stealing

title: High Performance Software Rasterization on GPUs
description: Sort-middle architecture for software rendering using compute shaders

title: How To Read Shader Assembly
description: Easy to follow overview on shader assebly

title: Massively-Parallel Rendering Of Closed-Form Implicit Surfaces
description: Rendering implicit surfaces(both 2D and 3D) on the GPU

title: Graphics Workshop
description: Learn computer graphics by writing shaders

title: Quickly Drawing a Rounded Rectangle With a GL Shader
description: Simple tutorial on how to draw rounded rects

title: Paxos Algorithm From The Ground Up
description: Learn the paxos algorithm interactively

title: Practical Byzantine Fault Tolerrance
description: Algorithm that is able to tolerrate Byzantine faults

title: Paxos
description: Family of protocols for solving consensus in an unreliable network

title: Notes On Paxos
description: May be useful to better understand the paxos algorithm

title: Diffie-Hellman Exchange For The Layman
description: Easy to understand explanation for Diffie-Hellman
